verses.text: In the seventh year of Jehu Jehoash \add began\add* to reign; and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
And Jehoash did \add that\add* which \add was\add* right in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc* all his days where\add in\add* Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
But the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

And Jehoash said to the priests, All the money of the dedicated \add things\add* that is brought \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, \add even\add* the money of every one that passeth \add the account\add*, the money that every man is set at, \add and\add* all the money that cometh into any man’s heart to bring \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*,
let the priests take \add it\add* to them, every man of his acquaintance: and let them repair the breaches of the house, wheresoever any breach shall be found.
But it was \add so, that\add* in the three and twentieth year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.

Then king Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest, and the \add other\add* priests, and said unto them, Why repair ye not the breaches of the house? now therefore receive no \add more\add* money of your acquaintance, but deliver it for the breaches of the house.
And the priests consented to receive no \add more\add* money of the people, neither to repair the breaches of the house.

But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one cometh \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*: and the priests that kept the door put therein all the money that was brought \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.

And it was \add so\add*, when they saw that \add there was\add* much money in the chest, that the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and they put up \add in bags\add*, and told the money that was found \add in\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.

And they gave the money, being told, into the hands of \add them\add* that did the work, that had the oversight \add of\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*: and they laid it out to the carpenters and builders, that wrought upon the house of the \sc Lord\sc*,
and to masons, and hewers of stone, and to buy timber and hewed stone to repair the breaches of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and for all that was laid out for the house to repair \add it\add*.

Howbeit there were not made \add for\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc* bowls of silver, snuffers, basons, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money that was brought \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*:
but they gave that to the workmen, and repaired therewith the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
Moreover they reckoned not with the men, into whose hand they delivered the money to be bestowed on workmen: for they dealt faithfully.
The trespass money and sin money was not brought \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*: it was the priests’.
Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it: and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.

And Jehoash king of Judah took all the hallowed \add things\add* that Jehoshaphat, and Jehoram, and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicate, and his own hallowed \add things\add*, and all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and \add in\add* the king’s house, and sent \add it\add* to Hazael king of Syria: and he went away from Jerusalem.
And the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
And his servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and slew Joash \add in\add* the house of Millo, which goeth down \add to\add* Silla.

For Jozachar the son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, smote him, and he died; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
